attributes.action: Create a memorial garden for all the people who have lost lives from covid 19.
attributes.additional_details: This would follow up their commitment to overcoming this terrible virus and bringing comfort for so many.   It would give a place for people to show thier respect for all those wonderful front line workers, remember loved ones and remain a place and event in history for future generations.  The will and resources were found to create the nightingale hospital, I'm sure a similar spirit and will can be found for a memorial garden.
attributes.background: This has been a tragic time and devastated so many families.  So many wonderful men, women and children have been taken, through covid.  Those on the front line especially.   I would like government to consider creating a memorial garden for those people to be remembered, and for families to unite.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Commission & fund a National Pandemic Memorial, Institute & annual commemoration: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314589

Create a National Covid-19 Key worker memorial Commemorate the fallen: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315516

A memorial for NHS, care, allied professionals, who die as a result of COVID:19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313328

Commission a Memorial Plaque to honour and remember UK victims of the Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310097

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
